item.title: Hugo Static Site
item.description: I had WordPress for a myriad of years ‚Äì it feels like. As my daily work involves moving clients away to other, less feature rich but more integrated solutions it became more and more pressing to check options for myself. Hugo is written in Go, a language that I chose to implement several big projects. Accidentally, Hugo became an inspiration and source for documentation when I started to look for good articles about Go's templating language that we use extensively.

item.title: New tool: gwget, wget based on file list, downloading only missing files
item.description: I had to pull only missing images from media folder of live to a staging server. Best way to do it was to ‚Ä¶ create a tool that does exactly what I had to do. http://github.com/shoobyban/gwget¬†is the result. Enjoy. ¬†

item.title: Go 1.10 party waitlist
item.description: Go 1.10 is not full of new features. But one feature makes me really happy, GOPATH being optional. I will be able to work in my projects folder (my hope, anyway). I'm a member of the¬†Go London User Group, although I have never managed to either turn up or get in yet. I wander if Gophers are as nice people as my e-commerce peeps. Oh by the way, I love math.

item.title: Golang experiments, Data Transformation
item.description: Wow, two years without (published) post! I‚Äôve started to experiment with Go in the meantime. I have to admit I‚Äôm far from being able to write good code in Go, not that I could tell this from any other programming languages, but hey, it‚Äôs something. As my normal day job involves some backend here and there and we are doing some serious ETL magic, I had to look around for a transformation language.

item.title: Another watchface
item.description: I have to say creating beautiful watchfaces is addictive. I had to create a new one, now a replica. I‚Äôve found a Gucci watch I would love to have ‚Äì but as a smartwatch. Creating it was fun, having it pure joy. See watchfaces page for details.

item.title: Watchface for Pebble published
item.description: I‚Äôve published my latest watchface, ShoMaurice, after using Maurice for a while and missing/disliking few things about it. I can‚Äôt help it. Pebble‚Äôs decision to make C the primary language for developing watchfaces was an excellent choice. Of course you can theoretically make apps in JavaScript but why? I have other projects as well but I enjoy this, with a few hours of coding I create something beautiful, then I carry it with me.

item.title: Pebble Smartwatch
item.description:
Pebble smartwatch projects ShoOne A simple watchface ShoOne watchface for Pebble Smartwatch.
This watchface is tailored to my taste. Analog watch with no second handle, rounded and distinguishable minute and hour handles, day of the week, day of the month, bluetooth connection vibration alert and display, battery and battery percentage, digital time display on the bottom, 3 and 9 o‚Äôclock digits for readability, so everything I need. Probably everything you will need and like.

item.title: PIM weekend update
item.description: Rewriting software is good. Code katas are good. Painful but good. Implementing the PIM on one platform and reimplementing it on a different one is especially painful. Implementing API instead of direct database connection feels nice though. As well as having an established framework like Symfony2. I had no real problem with the other one but when I will have to support it longer than the support will be available for the framework, sounds like a good idea to just switch ‚Äì and learn everything again.

item.title: PIM updates
item.description: In the past few weeks I have been working on the PIM (Product Management System) for my Magento instance. With the current setup we can work on the products without having to touch Magento admin. Product data is versioned and synchronised both ways on every PIM product list display ‚Äì this is not optimal but works well, I will probably create a cron job. Attributes and attribute sets are also synchronised, CRUD is ready but I don‚Äôt want to show it on the frontend.

item.title: Simple Product Information Management system for Magento
item.description: Product Information Management systems help you to manage product information centrally. In a sense Magento is a PIM. Magento doesn‚Äôt allow you to have versioned product data. In most cases this is not a problem, because you want to sell based on the latest information and you have a reliable content management team. But what if this is not the case, you have computer illiterate shop assistants or old people trying to manage the site?

item.title: Bee-Bot and Sphero magic is coming
item.description: We have a new pet at home ‚Äì a Sphero. Kids love it but most of the programming tools are not for 5 years olds. With the help of old turtle logic and their recent experience playing with Bee-Bots in school we had some fun already. Keep your eyes open, BeeSphero is coming! [Update 30/04/2014] Bee support didn‚Äôt react to my support request yet (Apple needs their approval too), I suppose they are busy developing the other bots‚Ä¶

item.title: Year ‚Äô13
item.description: This is the time of the year when I do my little stock-taking around my memories about last year. Mate had a good start in the school with the exception of some innocent violence pushing and kicking others. He has a good grasp of reading, he is using this newly acquired skill with confidence. The school turned out as an excellent choice. Daniel failed to get good GCSE grades, but we have found a course at East Surrey College for him where he seems to be happy.

item.title: Cache warmup based on sitemap
item.description: I work with multiple sites without cache warmup technology. So I created one. Don‚Äôt be mislead, it‚Äôs simple. Basic usage: <br /> $ ./warmup.rb www.someurl.tld<br /> It will download http://www.someurl.tld/sitemap.xml parse that sitemap for urls run through that list of urls, downloading every HTML to warmup the cache For further information and the code check up the Github repository

item.title: iRecipebook on Facebook
item.description: As I‚Äôm working on Facebook share ‚Äì there will be a share button under the recipe viewer screen that creates a Facebook note from the recipe ‚Äì I had to create a Facebook page so I can link to it from every post. Please like and check iRecipebook app Facebook page, I will update TODOs, fresh screenshots, recipes and my copy-paste resource links there.

item.title: Converting to Storyboard based design
item.description: As Apple is pushing Storyboard based app development I‚Äôve decided to give it a go. Having a family holiday with lots of spare time after the pools closed I‚Äôve started to pull it together for iRecipeBook. I had to find out how to simplify and standardise my old ‚Äì I mean really old ‚Äì code that I call guano code, created layer-by-layer as technology changed and requests came. Mostly it was about delegates, callbacks and properties ‚Äì duplicated here and there, non-standard solutions for supporting of older (iOS 4.

item.title: Core Data iCloud support on iOS
item.description: As of today, we still have 4.x systems running, iOS 5 is still not real minority, so I can‚Äôt just use iOS 6 API. After reading several articles and trying every framework and sample code I could find my verdict is the same, iOS is not ready for Core Data iCloud yet. The currently available iOS versions are not behaving the same way so either it‚Äôs a testing nightmare or just a nightmare, developers can choose.

item.title: iRecipeBook in Russian and Chinese
item.description: I had some time to focus on localisation. As 4.3 and 5.0 version is still majority so I can‚Äôt really put iCloud features in use, I did something instead for non-English speakers. I hope every translation is correct. If not, please let me know.

item.title: Toddlers‚Äô Blocks for iPad and iPhone
item.description: Finally I‚Äôve released my block-building game for the kids! They‚Äôve been testing it on the iPad for ages, asking for more faces, telling me that they like this, don‚Äôt like that etc. Of course for App Store screen-shots I had to modify the UI, for loading and saving block layouts, it‚Äôs hard to create the same screen-shots for all the resolutions‚Ä¶ and left a broken callback in the code even after testing, so 1.

item.title: Toddlers' Blocks - iPad and iPhone game
item.description: Toddlers‚Äô Blocks is a 2D block building game for toddlers and older kids up to 99 years old. No violence ‚Äì except of clashing blocks and downfalls ‚Äì no need to learn how to play it but helps to build confidence with real world physics. There is no real goal nor rules but to have fun. ¬†Update: 26/11/2015: Sorry but the app has been discontinued.¬†Support Please use this contact form to send us your comments, requests, ideas, bug reports.

item.title: Last year of maya calendar
item.description: This post is about last year. I have to say it was really colourful. Lets begin with office matters. This was my second year at the company, we had good year so management decided to go to other markets too. This meant new language to support, having fun with French again, c‚Äôest bon. New colleagues, lots of learning. Good and bad decisions, really good and really bad days too. At home we have helping hand (au pair) so my loved one Emese has a full time job again.

item.title: iRecipeBook for iPad
item.description: We have a new release! The iPad compatible iRecipeBook was a request, actually we had a bad review, stating that the ‚Äì iPhone only ‚Äì iRecipeBook looks wrong on the iPad‚Ä¶ The reviewer stated that five stars will be the award of an iPad compatible release. I‚Äôm waiting! Meanwhile I‚Äôm already working on localisations, social networking update (Facebook share, Twitter, Pinterest maybe‚Ä¶) and sharing recipes via email and from within the App.

item.title: New iRecipeBook release and more
item.description: iRecipeBook released in App Store just few weeks ago but we already have news about further developments. The new release will support iPad, will have iOS usability and design improvements. We plan to release it just before Christmas!

item.title: Magento
item.description: Magento is the most widely used e-commerce solution. My posts about Magento technology New tool: gwget, wget based on file list, downloading only missing files PIM weekend update PIM updates Simple Product Information Management system for Magento Cache warmup based on sitemap Creating Magento admin grid without database tables

item.title: Creating Magento admin grid without database tables
item.description: It‚Äôs not common that you have to display something that‚Äôs not in the Magento database. It was not too difficult to figure out how to do it but checking this might save you few minutes. Feel free to download the code itself: [Wizguild_VirtualGrid.zip][1]

item.title: MageHack 2012 London
item.description: I wanted to write a blogpost about MageHack 2012 London (magehack.com) but somehow failed until now. I‚Äôll be brief as it was long ago and the memory is fading fast. There was a pub warm-up event on the Friday before the event, with beers and schnitzel (a guy grabbed the last one just before me), sausages, mash‚Ä¶ we‚Äôve discussed our plans, trying to find out who will be possible project owner, who will join, and basically who‚Äôs who.

item.title: Moved domain finally
item.description: So here I am, finish multi-branding all say. I‚Äôm now on wizguild.com, migrating everything here. First of all, my projects on the main site (mostly done, more coming) and my¬†support sites for iOS apps. Although I have no time and intention to blog regularly I‚Äôve migrated my old stuff here for the posterity.

item.title: TextWrangler PHPTidy filter
item.description: it works with files (reading from file instead of standard input) there is a non-optional argument ‚Äúcommand‚Äù, as phptidy has lots of features it does not break lines after semicolons ‚Ä¶so I had to tweak the code a little. I hope you will find it useful. Oh, yes, your download link: PHPTidy text filter for TextWrangler For XMLTidy I use this shell script:

item.title: Updated iRecipeBook finally
item.description: It took terribly long to fix the built-in web server. Thank you for your support by using the App and sorry for annoyances. The focus is on social networking features now. As the database is bigger and bigger, especially after uploading images for every recipe I‚Äôve realized maybe we will have to implement an option to get rid of big images. The big image feature was introduced to help social networking publication, but clearly we can‚Äôt sacrifice launch performance.

item.title: iRecipeBook - Recipe book for iPhone, editable from web browser
item.description: <h2 class="post-title"> iRecipeBook ‚Äì Recipe book for iPhone, editable from web browser </h2> <p> <a href="http://wizguild.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/irecipebook_icon1.png"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-384" src="http://wizguild.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/irecipebook_icon1.png" alt="iRecipeBook" width="107" height="108" /></a>iRecipeBook is an easy to use recipe book application for your iPhone and iPod Touch with web remote editing feature. You can enable remote editing from the App, load up a web browser and freely copy-paste and edit your recipes. You can easily add lots of recipes with web based copy-paste function.

item.title: iWordsmith
item.description: <p> <span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong>Update: 26/11/2015: Sorry but the app has been discontinued.</strong></span> </p> <ul> <li> &#8211; 3&#215;3 challenge (8-9 letters long words) </li> <li> &#8211; 4&#215;4 challenge (-16 letters long words) </li> <li> &#8211; time challenge </li> </ul> <p> <strong>Q: How to play this game?</strong> </p> <p> A: Better to show in a video how to find and select a word. </p> <p> &nbsp; </p> ¬†<p> We are happy to get any feedback from you, success stories, ideas, misfeatures, bugs.

item.title: iPhone/iPad (old)
item.description: Our small team is publishing programs for the iPhone/iPad/iPod Touch market from inner drive. When we need a program, we code it and release it. When we need an update, we update it. Sometimes we have time to do updates by request, sometimes not. Sorry for the later, it‚Äôs not because you are not important, but because we have less resources. Update: 26/11/2015: Sorry but all apps have been discontinued. <p class="wp-caption-text"> iWordsmith game </p> </div></td> <td> <p> <div id="attachment_384" style="width: 117px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <a href="http://wizguild.

item.title: Five or More
item.description: Five or More is an addictive game, helps you to spend as much time as you can, also good for training concentration or pointing accuracy. The game‚Äôs objective is to align five or more balls of the same color causing them to disappear, as often as possible. This is the iPhone port of the game GLines, also known as Five Or More from Gnome Project. As an early pilot project please do not blame me for the awkwardness.

item.title: twenty-eleven
item.description: Looking back on the year, as usual. My memory is so bad I have to take notes üôÇ If last year was positive, it‚Äôs even better, in every aspects. I have a nice new job in a small international company as Head of IT / Architect, some kind of a CTO but with lots of fun around the code. We have few Magento systems, building new sites regularly, working with logistics companies and other partners connecting our systems to their, providing them data, sending and updating orders etc.

item.title: English ‚Äì Hungarian dictionary and idiom dictionary for Mac OS X spotlight
item.description: This is an English ‚Äì Hungarian dictionary and English idiom ‚Äì Hungarian dictionary for Mac OS X spotlight. Install the unzipped files it into /Library/Dictionaries and check /Applications/Dictionary.app settings for details. Download: Dictionary.zip 15.29 MB

item.title: wizguild.com ‚Äì Wizards Guild
item.description: We are moving domain, welcome to wizguild.com

item.title: About us
item.description: This is a guild of fine craftsmen from the software industry. We are not just blessed with knowledge but with kindness and openness to others‚Äô problems. Our focus is mainly Mac OS X, Go, iOS, Magento and any other PHP based development, e-commerce consulting, retail.

item.title: Go
item.description: I use Go every day as part of my work and as hobby. Here are my posts about Go Hugo Static Site New tool: gwget, wget based on file list, downloading only missing files Go 1.10 party waitlist Golang experiments, Data Transformation

item.title: =SUM(2009)
item.description: All right, time to post all things about 2009. I cannot wait longer. Pros: My son, M√°t√© (Matthew) was born in January I have a new app in iTunes App Store: iRecipeBook Acted as ‚ÄúMost Senior Apple Consultant‚Äù for Hungary I had nice server consolidation projects at Apcom Also I had very nice in-house development projects I had no major health problems Cons: Apcom is much smaller now There is a joke about recession: A recession is when your neighbour loses his job.

item.title: My Wok Chicken
item.description: 1 chicken breast 2 table spoon of olive oil 1 can of mushroom 1-2 carrot 1 table spoon of wok spice (contains salt, sugar, garlic, pepper, soy sauce, ginger, fenugreek, turmeric)‚Ä¶ I know this is cheating üòâ soy sauce 1 table spoon of starch 1 medium sized onion 100g of rice noodle water Clean and slice the chicken to 2√ó3 cm slices, fry them in olive oil till they are white.

item.title: Matt
item.description: In few days I realised I cannot finish this post. Update: My son Matthew turned 9 months few days ago. He is clever and as handsome as me üôÇ

item.title: Training on a Nikon D40
item.description: Tough DSLRs are not for those who cannot make a steady shot with a pocket cam I decided to buy a D40 after recognising that my pictures are full of noise. The challenge: to learn to shoot nice photos. I‚Äôve read tutorials, books about the subject, I know the basics, the theory, but this is different.

item.title: year++
item.description: Some key events in 2008: learnt the basics of the French language spent few¬†nice days in Paris again üôÇ fruitful vacation in D√∂br√∂nte ‚Ä¶ see last entry¬†üòâ I organized the first Apple summer camp and an educational week became Zyxel switch specialist and Apple Certified Technical Coordinator Emese is pregnant with my son üòÄ

item.title: Five or More is in App Store
item.description: Hurray, hurray and hurray. My little game is in the App Store! It took long, but it‚Äôs there. You can download it for free of course, search for ‚ÄúShooby‚Äù. I hope you will find it as annoying and fun as I do. Update: I have been reviewed by ‚Äúwhoneedsaname‚Äù. It‚Äôs fascinating how the guy writes!

item.title: Can‚Äôt wait to publish my iPhone apps
item.description: Five Or More game screenshot I‚Äôm still waiting Apple‚Äôs approval of my request to join their developer community. It‚Äôs not straightforward, because I cannot buy anything from Apple Store. I live on the wrong side of the world. I had to fax them papers to prove I will buy the subscription, now they are sitting on this paper and ask me to wait. It‚Äôs not so easy to wait, after waiting more than one year to release something it‚Äôs more than annoying.

item.title: Evening
item.description: I like to walk home with Emese, chatting about the day and whatching the nature around us.

item.title: periodic post, 0x20
item.description: I‚Äôm older, this is how the Universe works. And I blog this.¬†No comment.

item.title: OpenOffice.org 3 beta is fast!
item.description: I can‚Äôt wait the stable release! After years of watching the splash screen I was delighted to see how fast is the new OOo beta. Service guys has a big XLS price-list of the service parts, this beta software opened this huge file with such an easiness and speed‚Ä¶ I will like the native OOo, I think. NeoOffice is still better if you have to edit something, I had many problems with the fonts and chart sizes, this is normal for a beta software.

item.title: iPhone SDK
item.description: This morning I have finished porting iLines to official SDK. Works well. I have to admit there are drawbacks (lack of Interface Builder, coming soon) but my code was also buggy (I‚Äôm not surprised :)) So now I know I‚Äôll be able to write software and probably I‚Äôll do it. Before this Apple will have to release firmware 2.0 and this is the hardest thing to wait for something you can use now (theoretically).

item.title: Mac OS X leopard (aka 10.5) first impressions
item.description: The new cat gives me so much, I can‚Äôt count everything. After a clean install I have moved my programs into the Applications folder, then Application Support, Preferences and many things from my old home folder. After this I had a clean leo with my apps working (or not :)) I had to squash some bugs, too, for example FileMaker works with US locale but nothing else, hot-keys stopped working with international keyboard layouts (for example command-`, move focus to next window) this is really painful.

item.title: time to celebrate
item.description: Finally, the time has come. Steve Jobs announced the iPhone SDK, available from February, 2008! It‚Äôs so good to be Apple fan, again üôÇ Beware of my Apps üòÄ

item.title: programming is fun
item.description: Hell, yes. I had problem with a regexp today and I wrote a small eval() based code (3 or 4 lines) what I can use as debugger‚Ä¶ in the evening I had this crazy idea‚Ä¶

item.title: Recently
item.description: About last few months in nutshell: moved into our flat bought a Rover 45 (1.6i club, 2003 model) iStyle Hungary (company where I work) opened 2 new shops Maji is 10 years old summer was hot, we worked much

item.title: My Skype theme
item.description: It‚Äôs not official, barely legal (it‚Äôs from an Adium theme) but looks good. To install: get it here and after uncompressing copy it into /Applications/Skype.app/Contents/Resources/ChatStyles/ (or find the according folder on Linux and Windows). You cannot switch the color scheme and can‚Äôt show avatars, but it‚Äôs cute.

item.title: XKCD widget
item.description: I am mad, I know. I‚Äôve made the XKCD Time Factorisation widget for other XKCD fans from their comic strip. I hope you will find it funny. Another useless widget on your Mac OS X Dashboard :).

item.title: Ill
item.description: After 2 months of fighting with my pain and inflammation in my lung with aid of drugs like steroids and antibiotics I had to find that after I stopped to get those pills the pain and the inflammation came back. But it‚Äôs better than poisoning myself with steroids and drugs for blood pressure and so‚Ä¶ after one month of taking Medrol I had terrible headache (I mean terrible and way too long‚Ä¶ 3 weeks long without a minute stop) but it was better after I was able to stop taking it.

item.title: Alive
item.description: It‚Äôs so good to be alive! Thanks!

item.title: MacFUSE sshfs
item.description: Using Google‚Äôs MacFUSE for some weeks, I‚Äôm happy with it. It‚Äôs cool to have sshfs on Mac üôÇ

item.title: iPhone
item.description: Today Apple has announced iPhone. I want one. I want to write programs to it. I want to use it, now. I think I‚Äôm not alone.

item.title: Lake Omszki
item.description: This weekend we had some fun at the lake Omszki. Vakhangya and his son asked me about having a chat, Maji has a new ball so we played football. It was fun, except Vakhangya had some problem with his blood pressure‚Ä¶ I hope they are OK now üôÇ

item.title: Heviz ‚Äì honeymoon
item.description: This weekend we had nice weather at Heviz. I can‚Äôt remember the last time when we were so happy and relaxed. Heviz is Hungary‚Äôs most famous thermal lake, beautiful (with water lily) and radioactive water. I have no problem with my bones or muscles (the water is good for disabled people) but we had an invitation for 3 days. The weather was so warm I walked on the street in t-shirt.

item.title: Paris
item.description: Finally I‚Äôm here. I‚Äôve played with Xserves, Xserve RAIDs and fibre channel switches in the last few days, it was fun. French people are nice, the host of the training is a company is Agnosys.fr, a French Apple training company. They have good trainings as I understand their brochures. I‚Äôve learnt few new French words too and many about Apple video editing and server solutions. I love to be here üôÇ

item.title: Mac OS X ‚Äúcracked‚Äù
item.description: Of course, with a buggy 3rd party driver. So it‚Äôs not a real sensation, but good for the press (blooood!!! ahhhh!!!) Nonsense. Of course, the guy was smart, he had good stuff and the security hole is absolutely there‚Ä¶ Hijacking a macbook in 60 secs with a 3rd party WiFi card

item.title: Back home
item.description: In nutshell: Figthing cockroaches, working hard, trying to survive the hot weather.

item.title: From Ukraine
item.description: Beregszasz (Beregovo), Ukraine, Dormitory of Transcarpatian Hungarian College Named After Ferenc Rakoczi II‚Ä¶ tomorrow we will give speeches on free software for teachers. I‚Äôm sitting in front of my machine, after a long trip. We had a meeting in Nyiregyhaza with the others and some pizza then in a 5 cars long convoy we started to annoy the border guards üôÇ It was a dumb situation when the Ukrainian border guard asked us (of course in Ukrainian language) about why we are waiting in a forbidden area.

item.title: I hate to move
item.description: I mean from one rent into another‚Ä¶ kills me. Aaaahh!!!!

item.title: FYI
item.description: Today we got married silently.

item.title: Server Club
item.description: We will make a new event at A4 Apple Center (Andrassy street 4, Budapest) at Friday, Jun 30 about Mac OS X Server operating system and people around servers, read: system administrators. My friends (who are exceptional professionals super pro-gurus) will be there, if you have questions or want to meet someone (for example me) please come. I mean you are welcome. We will talk about servers, new technologies around Macs, free software projects, development, ideas, etc.

item.title: New server
item.description: So, after hard times I have another chance to express my ideas and feelings about my environment. I‚Äôve got new server! Wow, wow! I‚Äôm so happy! Few words about last months: I‚Äôm working at A4 Apple Center as Head of development, we are making financial systems for clients with Mac systems. I‚Äôm quite happy with my squash play. I had to make myself move somehow. Unfortunately BMP has moved back to Bicske so I haven‚Äôt got permanent partner.
Good question‚Ä¶ Maybe I have no spare time‚Ä¶ üôÅ

item.title: About 2005
item.description: OK, so it‚Äôs time for review last year. I‚Äôm happy it‚Äôs over. I hope I will like 2006 better. Projects: Two major Flash-MySQL-perl based TV show game (currently in use on ATV and Duna TV) Web sites (kepvadasz.hu, A4 Apple Center, ‚Ä¶) Call Center application in Cocoa, Webkit, PHP and MySQL OpenOffice.org 2.0 Hungarian version with Hunspell for Mac OS X, aka FSF.hu build contribution in TV show called Macians (currently I feel shame because I have no time) on Fix.

item.title: Nokia 6111 and Mac OS X aka. how to sync, problem v3
item.description: Yesterday I have bought a Nokia 6111. This is a good-looking Series 40 phone (sigh, no more python/c++ hacking, no more iSync)‚Ä¶ While there is a program to sync contacts, etc (works well with 6111) called PhoneDirector from MacMedia, I had to write my own (and free) app to upload the contents of my Address Book to the phone. Gnokii is a good choice, if you have just one contact to sync but if you have few hundred you will have to make a script.

item.title: NeoOfficeJ for Java 14x
item.description: New, faster, with fewer Java based bugs. Cool! I have to say Patric is working hard and making fantastic things around NeoOffice/J. Thanks, and please keep this process. Feel free to download the performance patch, it applies to 1.1 (downloadable from neooffice.org)‚Ä¶

item.title: Mighty Mouse in real
item.description: Yesterday I brought home the first Mighty mouse for testing. I have to say I was right. This is an evolutionary mouse, but users will have to learn to use it. Clicking with the right, left or the middle (OK, its better to say 1,2,3 or primary etc.) button is easy if you don‚Äôt think just do it. But when you see what you do (for example I lift my other fingers up) you will try to do it other ways and it does not work like that.

item.title: New mouse from Apple
item.description: I like Mighty Mouse! It seems usable, it‚Äôs cute, Apple knows how to make a real product! It‚Äôs so cute! Oh my! ‚Ä¶. I‚Äôll have problem with buttons at the right and left side, though. I hate to click accidentally. I hope I will like it when I‚Äôll got one üôÇ

item.title: Still lots of staff to close
item.description: Tomorrow I will start another ‚Äúbig project‚Äù and I still have lots of unfinished stuff here. I will have to make agreements with my previous clients who are complaining for support (unfortunately all of them think it‚Äôs free, gratis, etc‚Ä¶) Normally I help them as I should, but after a number of requests I start to slow down, losing interest. I know it‚Äôs not the best what I can do, but they don‚Äôt want to pay my time and although I really like them (not all of them, but in general) I have to do my other jobs, too.

item.title: Great!
item.description: We had great time at Mogyor√≥d, exactly two days time. Nice weather, sweeeeeet relaxation, lazing all the day! Wohoooo! We have spent two days at the Aquapark and it‚Äôs camping, right before the Formula 1 madness. Back to work! Brrrr‚Ä¶

item.title: Guess what!
item.description: Guess, what will produce this small program.

item.title: Weeks in run
item.description: Hard times, again. Hard to find time to stop, I feel something is missing. Maybe some holiday. While checking our schedule, we decided to have a break at next week. This is our last hope. I could just hope this will be OK for my clients and for Emese‚Äôs boss. The plan is to camp out somewhere near, for example the Aquapark near Mogyorod‚Ä¶ hmm‚Ä¶ sounds relaxing. Although I need some rest, the weather forecasts and state of my projects make me feel bad about the next week‚Ä¶ we will see.

item.title: SSL Courier IMAP certificate on Debian
item.description: Easy way to create a new certificate instead of the autogenerated one which comes with ‚Äúapt-get install courier-imap-ssl‚Äù: check your /etc/courier/imapd.cnf move the file /etc/courier/imapd.pem to another name or location dpkg-reconfigure courier-imap-ssl restart imapd and check if everything was ok

item.title: Birthday party of Yoro
item.description: We had great time at Gy≈ër√∫jbar√°t. The weather was nice (little hot), the food was fantastic, and the most important, I met my good old friends from the college. Happy 30th, Yoro.

item.title: Google Map of Budapest
item.description: Oh, yes. We are in. This is the World from where I am now. Sounds cool, ha?

item.title: Day with great things
item.description: Emese‚Äòs Birthday, she had a successful psychology exam (congratulations, Emese and Happy Birthday). I‚Äôm in trouble every time I have to buy presents. I want to buy her something neat, something what will make her happy. It‚Äôs hard to find.

item.title: My English
item.description: It‚Äôs bad, I know. I‚Äôm not native, but I‚Äôm working on my English. I have found a page to test my profile.

item.title: Think Different
item.description: This weekend I had to figure out how the hack will I make the Mac OS X clients authenticate from Solaris 10 and Mac OS X server. Netinfo is better, it‚Äôs easy to make it work on Mac OS X, but hard to compile on Solaris. I have to configure NIS on the Sun and test if it works.

item.title: Something is wrong
item.description: I have to restart my blog because of a hard drive error. No backups, no mirror. Eeeek. Sounds terrible. Update: I have managed to restore my blog entries from Google cache. Thanks, guys!

item.title: Mac OS X and character problem
item.description: After replying the umpteen e-mail about Hungarian language specific (latin2) √µ and √ª character problem I have made a FAQ page. I describe how to solve the problem when Word and NeoOffice does not see the √µ and √ª characters in a document comes from Windows. It‚Äôs basically a problem specific documentation for FontBook, Apple‚Äôs most important but not-so-well-known application. (Update: Will have to find the document to correct the links)

item.title: Nice breakfast
item.description: I‚Äôm sitting in a small but nice place called Caf√© Cr√©me just on the corner, near to our flat. The sandwich was fine (with chorizo), Emese had a melange (she said it was much more like melange compared to the others she had) and we are both using our own WiFi network from home, working and surfing‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a beautiful day, good start.

item.title: Yellow Dog Linux 4.0 on iMac G5 combo
item.description: I‚Äôm happy with my new iMac G5, it‚Äôs fast, beautiful‚Ä¶ but. I cannot install (without hacking) YDL on it, because YDL 4.0 installer does not recognise its combo drive. Is this serious? üôÅ I will check it again soon but I have no time for hacking a new install set‚Ä¶ I will have to find another ppc distro. (Update: I have successfully installed YDL 4.0.1)

item.title: Death of my harddrive
item.description: HDD of my little powerbook is living it‚Äôs last hours. I‚Äôm running the system from my iPod because the harddrive gives terrible noises‚Ä¶ I wonder if it will serve me more than days before the final stop. I will miss my data so bad‚Ä¶ (Update: in may my harddrive made its last moves‚Ä¶ RIP, old drive)

item.title: New install on my PB
item.description: I had to reinstall my system after more than a year of stability. I think I will have to avoid installing third party programs and system extensions. I could just hope my backup was complete üôÇ After the reinstall I had 35 gigs of space, holy hard drive! OK, OK. After installing the most necessary programs and my backup data I have just 20 gigs of 40, but it‚Äôs kind of interesting how many rubbish I used to store.

item.title: NeoOffice 12A2 FSF.hu build
item.description: Yes, a Hungarian NeoOfficeJ! I did it! Available from http://ftp.fsf.hu/NeoOfficeJ, it‚Äôs still in testing, but usable. Feel free to use it, it‚Äôs a free software (forums and other stuff at Trinity BBS)

item.title: Chatroom links from web pages
item.description: It‚Äô not so hard, you can link your favourite AIM (iChat) chat room at your site: beszeljukmac chatroom (this is the Hungarian mac chatroom with good traffic, it‚Äôs hard to find it empty). I hope I will find more chatroom links in the future‚Ä¶ üôÇ

item.title: Successful Free Software show at Dunaujvaros
item.description: I have taken some photos, reachable from http://shooby.gnome.hu/pics/2004_10_11_dunaujvaros_fsf.hu_roadshow/. We have promises about video recordings of the event, I will have to write a video cd from my presentation, it was such a success‚Ä¶ üôÇ

item.title: Talk at Infotrend 2004 Conference
item.description: INFOtrend is a trade fair and conference at the HUNGEXPO Budapest Fair Center, 26-28 october 2004. I have been invited to give a talk about Linux in the office environment.

item.title: FSF.hu Roadshow stops at Dunaujvaros
item.description: On monday the FSF.hu roadshow team will visit Dunaujvaros to deliver speeches about Free Software and Open Source solutions. I will talk about free software development tools. Location of the event: Kerpely Antal Dormitory, Diszterem, Duna√∫jv√°ros, Semmelweis u. 5.

item.title: Mac fanatic show at FIX.tv again
item.description: Weekly at Thursday, 20:00 CET (OK, OK, after 15 minutes of ads) about Apple history, Mac OS X and Mac users and fanatics, news, rumors‚Ä¶ We will show you our Mac üôÇ Come and join us, our iChat room will be ‚Äúbeszeljukmac‚Äù hopefully, live stream is at mms://www.fix.tv/fixdsl (blah, WM stream, not QT)

item.title: Blog calendar works again
item.description: OK, finally I had some time to fix a bug in the dateFilter checking code‚Ä¶

item.title: Making custom AFP shares
item.description: I hate to make temporary users and set passwords. I have made a small shell script to help me making custom AFP shares. How to use it (from Terminal): $ mkafpshare.sh sharename /path/of/directory/to/share You will have to type in an administrator password (script uses sudo), then turn off and on Personal File Sharing in System Preferences/Sharing. When you are connecting to your mac from another mac, choose guest, and voil√†, new share üôÇ

item.title: NeoOffice 11 alpha
item.description: Oh yes! It‚Äôs incredible! I have NeoOffice based on OpenOffice 1.1 code, thanks to Patrik. Direct link to the news entry. Knows Hungarian umlaut characters, faster, able to save PDF, etc‚Ä¶ By the way, I managed to make the Hungarian spell checker and hyphenation work‚Ä¶ At home I will try to build my own Hungarian version, too!

item.title: New machine on board
item.description: After long delay (waiting for service, about 3 weeks or more) few days ago (ok, I know, I‚Äôm a bad blogger) I got my first dual processor system. Reeeealy cute!!! A real PowerMac G4 (Gigabit Ethernet model) with two 450 MHz CPU, RAM and some other parts cannibalised from another systems. Yes, the seller have changed the hard drive to a noisy 20 gig one, my first step was to

item.title: Update for anti software patent demonstration
item.description: I‚Äôm planning to join the demonstration. If you are in Hungary and you are software developer or user you should consider to join us. Software patents are bad. This is one of our banners:

item.title: Anti software patent demonstration
item.description: The European Parliament will have a vote on the issue in September about software patents. We are in the works to make that little difference by putting pressure on the Hungarian government to withdraw their support for the current draft. We plan a demonstration and talks. Our last ‚Äì and only ‚Äì chance to influence the decision to be made seems to be to put some pressure on the officials

item.title: I have subversion
item.description: I have been using cvs for ages. Jul is subversion fan, I wanted to try it out, so I had to install it. Every time I said ‚Äúfink install svn‚Äù or ‚Äúfink install svn-client-ssl‚Äù I got frightened from 40 new packages (apache2 and others) so I had to find something. So I had to recognise I was blind‚Ä¶ on subversion‚Äôs official site there is a link to an easy installing dmg‚Ä¶ shame on me, again üôÇ

item.title: Childroom destroy party
item.description: We‚Äôve been planning to renovate the kid‚Äôs room for long time. On Sunday we have started to remove the old wallpaper, move the furniture to other room, etc. Now we have a new wallpaper, and some time. Wallpaper have to dry, then we will paint it and build the new furniture‚Ä¶ hard days.

item.title: English-Hungarian dictionary on Cocoa power
item.description: There is a new version of English-Hungarian (Angol-Magyar) dictionary at http://egeronline.com/szotar/. I like this Cocoa application, it has nice background, it‚Äôs free, fast and it can speak the English text (OK, there is no speak support for Hungarian in Mac OS X). Good job, iJoe!

item.title: Video chat with guys at the Sziget Festival
item.description: Scold have asked me to check for his iSight signal on the Sziget festival so I‚Äôve seen some nice people out there. They were a bit foggy, I think they will have to look for some way to force set the focus‚Ä¶ On Thursday hopefully I will check them IRL.
Few days ago I have grown old. I‚Äôm still shocked. Nobody told me about how it feels getting older and older every year. The cake was fine. Thanks for all the good wishes.

item.title: Back from the CERN
item.description: I‚Äôm tired and extremely happy, I was able to see the Data Center of CERN (European Organization for Nuclear Research, read Nuclear part as inner particles of atoms, protons and electrons not as nuclear technology). I have been invited by Interware Rt. (a five stars server hosting hotel) with many young (and not so very young) IT professionals and Interware‚Äôs most important business partners. For Your Information: The visit in CERN is for FREE.

item.title: Final Fantasy X2
item.description: At last, I managed to buy a FFX-2. Unfortunately, the seller did not tell me it‚Äôs a German version. We are fighting with the game. I mean I‚Äôm fighting with the German language menus, I have ‚Äúdifficulties‚Äù with German. So I will try to find the way to exchange it to an English version. The game is fantastic, but the new combat mechanism (aktivemodus, brrr) is too fast for me. I like to

item.title: My first real camera
item.description: This week Olympus finally have shipped C-765 UZ cameras to Hungary. At last. I have bought one, I‚Äôm quite happy with it. It‚Äôs a small 10X optical zoom, 4.0 megapixel digital camera with QuickTime video recording capabilities (with sound).

item.title: Our Towel Day
item.description: The day before yesterday we had excellent Towel Day. The participants were: Jul, Szimszon, Bmp, Kecsi and me. What is Towel Day? Towel Day has been declared by an internet movement to celebrate Douglas Adams‚Äô memory, it is set for 25th May. The idea was that people carry their towel with them everywhere on that day as a tribute to Doulgas Adams. So carry your towel with you throughout the day, think about Hitchhikers

item.title: Gnome 2.6
item.description: Gnome 2.6 is out! I feel shame, I had no commits since the last release. I will have to check GKB and Glines if they were working‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs hard to use a PC‚Ä¶ I have found the missing key tab file for my ill-fated gkeycaps program, I will try to continue the coding‚Ä¶ I have forgot to commit it into the Gnome CVS and the program does not work without this file üòõ

item.title: Folding Home
item.description: I‚Äôm folding proteins on my locked screen (I normally do not use any screensaver but screen locks)‚Ä¶ Few days ago I have found (again) a protein folding project, called Folding@Home. The goal of the project is understand how to fold proteins and protein aggregation, helping to fight Alzheimer‚Äôs and Parkinson‚Äôs disease, Mad Cow (BSE), CJD and ALS‚Ä¶ I love to help, so I have downloaded the GUI and the screensaver and joined to Team Mac OS X.

item.title: Good changes are invisible
item.description: So this will be a bad change üôÇ I tried to change my old tr/td based blog design to blosxom.php kind div/css based. I hope this will be future-aware, I had to work with this for long hours‚Ä¶ üôÇ If you have an idea about how to position the navi div to not to collide with the main div at bigger font sizes‚Ä¶ Yes, there is font size relative sizing

item.title: Fortune today
item.description: I have made a presentation about ‚ÄúMultimedia on the Macintosh‚Äù on the DigitalWorld Conference today. I had success, I made a real ‚Äúshow‚Äù in twenty minutes (:-P). Before my presentation there was a drawing, I had luck, maybe first time in my life :). I have won a Genius G-Shot P313 camera!

item.title: Openoffice.org in a dmg
item.description: Yes, I have found the way of doing an OpenOffice.org package, with just-mount-and-drag-and-drop install. I have still difficulties with the user directory and the X11 presence, but I will solve it. I had promising meeting with the HDSys (the Hungarian apple distributor), after testing and bugfixes they will probably bundle it for Central European languages. I have the Hungarian version already working on my desktop üôÇ My next project is to make a Hungarian, tested version of NeoOffice/J, but

item.title: TV star: ‚ÄúI+‚Äù in FIX.tv
item.description: I will be one of the hosts in i+ (pronounced: Allj meg, means ‚Äústop‚Äù), a new tv show in fix.tv. The show will show Mac vs. PC fight from one aspect. And old iMac (base G4 with some extra ram) versus an AMD 2GHz monster. Uh. This will be a hard fight. We will try to introduce Macintosh for the public. Fix.tv is a small tv channel about interactive multimedia and computing, music clips and cars,

item.title: Oracle on my Mac
item.description: Last week I installed Oracle 9.2 to my PowerBook. I have still problems setting it up in changing network environment (I have to reedit /etc/hosts every time I got new IP address) but runs well on my little book. I had to make an oracle user, with sudo rights‚Ä¶ The tomcat setup has changed between jaguar and panther, so I had to edit some scripts (allup.sh and alldown.sh) to make it run properly.

item.title: Logging in to Mac OS X from modem
item.description: I got a support call from my old friend, Meszi. He has a customer who wanted to use his Mac server from a modem connection. After a sort search I found mgetty has been ported to Mac OS X. The link is here: http://www.leo.org/~doering/mgetty/ I had to change Makefile a bit (there is no fax and modem user or group), I bet nobody will be enough. On panther I had to remove an ‚Äúextern int sys_nerr;‚Äù from the logfile.

item.title: Wannabe Lord of the (snow)boards
item.description: Sunday we will leave for a skying trip, 5 days without Internet access (Panic! Panic!)‚Ä¶ I think this will be hard. What more, I will have to leave my PowerBook home üôÅ No way. What will I do in the hospital after breaking my bones on the slope? üòÄ I definitely have to bring the notebook.

item.title: Almakor MUG meeting last weekend
item.description: This was such an event! GarageBand demo, beautiful machines‚Ä¶ aaand‚Ä¶ 512M RAM more in my PowerBook üôÇ I‚Äôm happy with the speedup, but of course I have to wait for some apps, yet. I am waiting for G5 notebooks üôÇ

item.title: Apple Center in Paris
item.description: After some calculations I‚Äôve decided to buy new battery for my Powerbook here. I will have problems with warranty but the price was cheaper (around 35 Euros). It‚Äôs hard to find an Apple shop! I checked apple.fr for the list of resellers, then I met with different shops: We‚Äôve had some problem with France Telecom (their phone boxes are not properly working every time) but Sebastien solved the problem. So I managed to buy the battery so now I‚Äôm happy but I have to wait for Emese

item.title: From Paris
item.description: Here we are, Sebastien‚Äôs place‚Ä¶ changed a lot‚Ä¶ new furnitures, washing machine‚Ä¶ Cool. Today we will try to visit some museums and the Eiffel tower, the weather is cold but nice. Today morning I managed to buy some bread and Coke, in French. I‚Äôm proud of myself üôÇ

item.title: Will be off to Paris
item.description: Tomorrow evening we will visit Sebastien (this is a picture, his website is down) in Paris. This is the first time Maji will join to us, he will be a bit unhappy with the other people speaking foreign languages and no Hungarian. He can understand some basic words and expressions like ‚ÄúYes‚Äù, ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, ‚ÄúOK‚Äù, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go‚Äù in English but nothing in French. We will show him the city, I‚Äôm sure he will enjoy the trip.

item.title: Gimp seminar in NIIF
item.description: Last week I held a seminar about GIMP, within the confines of IPSZILON project by NIIF. There were a live stream and there will be an archive some day later. I had to cut half my planned presentation, because the audience had no idea about picture formats, colours and other fundamentals, but I think they were happy with those nifty tricks after the killing theories.

item.title: Lord of the Ring 3 ‚Äì Return of the King
item.description: OK, yesterday evening I managed to collect my friends and buy tickets for LOTR3. I enjoyed it, the film had outstanding visual effects ‚Äì except the hobbits‚Ä¶ The bluebox stuff was lame and badly lighted. The storyline was well made, not much quake-like bloodbath‚Ä¶ I think the giant spider was a bit too scarry. The end was long, but they left out the last boring events from the book, so it was a bit hollywood-kind end (family, kids, happy wife

item.title: After important exams
item.description: I like it! I have some time today to write a blog entry about my exams and other things. I did my exams well (I have written a graphics and an applied informatics exam last week, a numeric recipes exam yesterday), I will have to make a homework about didactics and I will have a programming languages exam next week, too. Then two more semesters and I got my MSC!

item.title: Fun with a Powermac G5
item.description: I borrowed a PowerMac G5 form HAndras, I met him first on a MUG meeting where I saw his G5 (A clip from HAndras) He managed to sell his ‚Äúold‚Äù 1.6 GHz model and to buy a new one, a freaking dual 2GHz G5. While the old one is waiting for the new owner HAndras was so kind he gave it to me to compile the OpenOffice.org. I am so happy!
